learning_outcomes.description: Explain the nature and basic concepts of research in the context of the main disciplines; earth sciences, environmental management, environmental science, geography and planning.
Conduct a literature search using relevant library tools to identify the core areas of knowledge and questions requiring research to answer.
Construct a critical review of a published body of research in your discipline area.
Construct a research proposal using a recognised research design methodology from the discipline area that you work within.
Identify techniques available for the collection of biophysical, social, economic and cultural data and justify their use in certain projects.

Translate research objectives or questions into tasks of: data collection, analysis, argument, experiment or project, as is appropriate to your discipline. Develop a plan to undertake the work considering constraints of time, equipment, field conditions and coordination with other researchers or consultants; and present this as a time-line or task-schedule for your project.

Produce a standard format research proposal that clearly distinguishes the research findings from existing knowledge and argues for the significance of the research. Present this clearly to both specialist and non-specialist audiences and readers. The completed research proposal and presentation will guide your research in the following semester(s), through to the presentation of the dissertation.

assessments.task_description: 3MT-style presentations on research projects or topics. This is an online presentation with recording (for record-keeping).
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be delivered online (please discuss it with the Course Coordinator).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students are required to develop a critical review of the literature relevant to their research project.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted through Turnitin from the Blackboard site by 2 pm on Friday in Teaching Week 10.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Participation of contact sessions and communicate on your research proposal
assessments.task_description: Students will have the opportunity to conduct in-depth discussions with course staff. Students are required to participate in a few contact sessions during the semester. Contact sessions will include mini lectures and discussions. Students are also required to communicate their research proposal with their peers and the course staff during these contact sessions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Participation will be recorded during the semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Contact sessions

This course provides much flexibility for student participation. Students and course staff will schedule to meet a few times during the semester.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
